Between all 3 games, this one has to be my favorite for the sake of aesthetics, gameplay, lore, and story.  The ending can take around 5 YouTube explanation videos, a couple of guides, and two or three Reddit posts before you can wrap your mind around what's happening, but it is well worth it.  I've played this game multiple times across several different platforms, and it has always stood out as being my favorite among the Bioshock games.  

If it wasn't for the Burial at Sea DLC, then 1 would've taken that prize, but I highly recommend this game for anyone wanting to play a fun FPS with a great story and a love for light alternate history.

I couldn't finish it. The whole story is so forced and badly written that my eyes almost rolled right out of my freaking skull. Elizabeth was whiny as hell I just wanted her to stop talking and her head is so big that it just looked comical or something. Combat is fun and magical powers are cool to use, but I am never playing another game where half of time is spent running around looking for stuff to loot of which about 9/10 is garbage you don't even want or need.

You could tell that this was a game trying to be like the first 2 BioShocks and it was just all wrong. It is like BioShock is the Dad, BioShock 2 is his hot daughter, BioShock Infinite is like an inbred 4th cousin. Related somehow but not really the same at all and not worth playing.
这几年来玩过的最好的游戏之一。

I don't think I've under fully understood the ending of a game less than this one. 

It's not too long of a game like the other BioShock games, while it definitely plays and feels like a Bioshock game, it manages to change the entire environment and introduce entirely new concepts very well.
Genuinely one of my favorite games

Diría que recomiendo el juego pero...
este juego dicen.... el mejor del mundo... pues no.
Vamos a ver, el juego este le pasa que es un juego para gente que no tiene visión espacial del "mundo", entonces tienes que ir por diferentes pasillos con una niña de mierda, que me cae bien la niña, yo aquí no digo que la niña sea un problema, sabes? PERO es un aburrimiento tío porque en el pasillo te vas encontrando distintos enemigos y TODOS te quieren matar. Entonces, tu tienes que pegarles con tus snaipus y tus fusiles y siempre te quedas sin balas porque hay muchos malos con mucha vida y otros que son muy hijos de pu ta y cuando te mueres te mueres pero pierdes dinero. 
En cuanto a gameplay: ABURRIDÍSIMO, porque parece el CoD pero el CoD está mejor por los tiros ahí al menos te lo pasas bien esto es un despropósito
pero la gente dice de este juego... "PERO NOOO LOS TIROS NO SON LO IMPORTANTE", pues vamos a ver si me quiero enterar de la Historia tengo que jugar al pu to juego ¿no?

En cuanto a Story: es lo mejor del juego realmente pero yo cuando quiero enterarme de una historia me leo un libro, me veo una peli, no sé, pero no me pongo a pegar tiros
pero bueno... los personajes son memorables y hay plot twist, en cuanto a historia de voy a dar un ocho, PERO EN CUANTO A GAMEPLAY UN 0
Al menos es corto, así que para enterarte de la Historia sacrificar 12 horas de tu tiempo tampoco es tan malo

Una cosa más: yo jugando a este juego me daba dolores de cabeza, no sé por qué, supongo que mucha mierda en pantalla, pasaban todo el rato cosas. Sonidos por ahí, luego la música, luego la Elisabeth diciendo que tiene munición... que esa es otra, que la gente flipa con la Elisabeth, y tampoco es tan buen personaje, o sea no; es mejor Ellie CLARAMENTE, no tengo ninguna puta duda
así que bueno, los simps de la Elisabeth al carrer, a chuparla, que tampoco es pa tanto.
Así que nada recomendado si te sobra mucho el tiempo, pero bueno, que está bien el juego. Ya esta, esa es mi review

Растеряв множество интересных идей из прошлых частей, Bioshock Infinite пошел по пути упрощения, подобно множеству других современных игр, но, тем не менее, игра все так же увлекательная и не отпускает от себя до самых титров. Во многом это заслуга возросшей динамики, во многом – интригующего сюжета.

Там, где не хватает интересного экшена, нас подхватывает сюжет, а в моментах, когда история провисает, нас выручают действительно непростые схватки. Таким образом, те десять часов, за которые проходиться игра (а это очень даже немало), пролетают как миг и оставляют какое-то грустное ощущение, ибо хочется еще Колумбии, еще полетов на рельсах и, конечно же, еще Элизабет.

Такие игры – редкость в наше время, поэтому даже не думайте игнорировать новый Биошок. Прогуляться по улицам Колумбии должен каждый.
结局令人震撼

This game will go down in history as an all time classic, and it is one of my top 5 favorite games of all time. I've played through Bioshock Infinite more than 10 times on various difficulty settings and consoles/pc. I love the music, atmosphere, story and gameplay. It's on sale now so GET IT!

[b][h1]------------------------Bioshock Infinite------------------------[/h1][/b]

[u][b]Sinopse[/b][/u]  [b]-[/b] Indebted to the wrong people, with his life on the line, veteran of the U.S. Cavalry and now hired gun, Booker DeWitt has only one opportunity to wipe his slate clean. He must rescue Elizabeth, a mysterious girl imprisoned since childhood and locked up in the flying city of Columbia. Forced to trust one another, Booker and Elizabeth form a powerful bond during their daring escape. Together, they learn to harness an expanding arsenal of weapons and abilities, as they fight on zeppelins in the clouds, along high-speed Sky-Lines, and down in the streets of Columbia, all while surviving the threats of the air-city and uncovering its dark secret.

흡인력있는 스토리

I played this game years ago on XBOX and decided to try it again on PC. I was surprised to find that it is still one of the most satisfying, immersive, and fun experiences I have ever had playing a video game. The combat is enjoyable, but the world is so rich, alive, and unique. I love the characters, I love the setting, I love the music and the sound, I love the breathtaking graphics which still feel fresh. There are times when the story meanders and can sometimes be hard to follow, when the gameplay gets a tad repetitive, but those felt like the exception rather than the rule. Definitely my top three favorite games of all time.

Comparado com os outros jogos da franquia, Bioshock 1 e 2, Infinite foi uma decepção na minha opinião. Eu particularmente achei a história do Infinite fraca e confusa. A jogabilidade está melhor, menos travada, mas como o arsenal de armas aumentou, e aumentou MUITO, você quase não usa plasmideos, que aliás, sofreram um GRANDE nerf se comparado com os dos outros games. O positivo de Infinite é sim sua protagonista Elizabeth. Não, Booker não é o protagonista, você pode até jogar com ele, mas quem rouba a cena é definitivamente Elizabeth. Ainda mais com a DLC "Bureal at Sea", que fecha não só Infinite (meio que salva o game, porque a DLC é melhor que o game principal, tanto em história quando em uso dos plasmideos, que finalmente são uteis) mas fecha a trilogia perfeitamente, com chave de ouro e um final lindo e triste. Então se for comprar Infinite, e ainda mais, for jogar a DLC, recomendo comprar o pacote completo, os 3 games + as DLCs.

Até então minhas 16 horas foram muito bem gastar e, infelizmente, é triste saber que em breve estarei me despedindo desse universo tão rico. 
Resumo: Bão.

[h1] "There's always a lighthouse, always a man and always a city" [/h1]
Bioshock Infinite is another work of art by 2K, which discusses themes such as racism, indoctrination, religion and concepts surrounding multiverse. It's a great FPS game with great soundtrack, detailed textures and an absolutely amazing world to explore as well as a very intriguing (and somewhat complicated) story at that. But let's not pretend it's perfect. Unlike Bioshock and Bioshock 2, which are two of my most favorite FPS games ever, Infinite just didn't click with me as much as they did. The first two games had a much darker story with a lot of amazing characters (Ryan, Lamb, Tenenbaum...), let's not forget about the Big Daddies and the Little Sisters concept which made "Bioshock" the game. However, Bioshock Infinite definitely has its moments, and its unique story really conveyed a shocking twist when you figure everything out; it blew my mind for the most part. There were a few plot holes for sure, which didn't affect the story that much in my opinion but I think the Burial At Sea DLC made it worse, so basically if you didn't understand the ending of the main game and played those two episodes in the hopes of getting your questions answered, you'll only be more confused, but the DLC is still worth playing just for the sake of going back to Rapture. I actually think that the developpers did a great job making the connection between Rapture and Columbia. Overall, Bioshock Infinite is a hell of an FPS game to play and that alone is enough to try it out. In other words, if you want to enjoy it as much as you can, be patient, read between the lines and just let it tell you its story. Highly recommended.

BioShock Infinite feels a little bit dated, now. The story is a good one and it's worth playing through but you'll find that it's very contrived in some places. (It has to be, since this is only a shooter: you have no real agency or choices to make.) The previous two BioShock games offer a better vibe for barnstorming fun, with the added bonus that they still work on a modern Mac (if gaming on a Mac should happen to be your thing).

This game has all you can ask for: FPS, magic skills, and a good storyline. There are also quite a number of jumpscares and it's also worth it to search every nook and cranny for items. This is my third time playing this game.
I love the plot of this game, like many plot twist and [spoiler] the time travel, the multiple parallel universes [/spoiler]
